text: Came in here for a late night meal. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Overall the food was decent, good flavors largely Americanized of course. The menu is pretty broad, so you can definitely find something of interest if going with picky eaters.

Two words: Mongolian Beef! Thought I was going to throw up on the table. My wife enjoyed her chicken Pad Thai  and the appetizers were good. (Spicy chicken wings and summer shrimp rolls) service was good but the MongolianBeef and the veggie fried rice?

It was a very crowded lunch rush but I was seated immediately Kris was my waiter. So friendly and pleasant I told him I recently stopped eating meat but still dabbled with seafood and recommended the veggie stir fry however I told him I wanted something spicy so I got the Kung Pao Shrimp with extra veggies! It was so damn good! Kinda pricey for lunch $17 but I will be back!

I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki, OMG LORD this was the worst food Ive ever tasted. The rice was dry and over cooked, the chicken was dry as if it was cooked days ago. It was ABSOLUTLEY HORRIBLE. I would never eat here again

Not a fan of this place unfortunately despite wanting to like it. The ambience of this place is clean and modern with good service and the menu has some good variety but the quality of food here is just not up to what it should be. I ordered the kung pao chicken and had I know that I would be eating half a can of Morton's salt perhaps I would've gone for a salad instead. There aren't many choices for a non high-end Chinese restaurant in this neighborhood but I think Panda Express might be a better alternative.  Besides the one dimensional flavors of the two dishes I got (I think they may have used the same sauce and only one type of flavor), they were just wayyyyyyyy too salty. I have been to this place twice so I feel like it wasn't a mistake that they added too much salt.  I would highly highly recommend toning down the salt in the dishes. This restaurant by physical structure, variety, and location has a lot of potential but the food is just not good.
I ordered lunch portion of shrimp pad thai. When I took it out, it was like an appetizer.  very small amount for $13.95 + tax!  Flavor was ok.  Heck, panda's can be just as good.

Interesting Chinese and Thai menu with good lunch combos-- affordable. It can be busy on weekdays, especially in the summer months with tourists, but the wait staff handle it well for the most part.  The kitchen-to-wait staff system can go awry and make the wait longer than desirable.   My lunch mate and I pointed out that the hot and sour soup tasted funny (sweet to me, salty to her-- so we almost didn't say anything, but) and immediate action was taken by the waiter to take it to the kitchen manager. It never went on the bill.

Calledout in for delivery after a day on t the town. Uber Eats delivered it hot and fast. Used the make your own meal, very good. The Szechuan chicken was seasoned perfectly, spicy but not hot. Everything made from scratch and when ordered.

If you're not looking to splurge I suggest you don't come here. Yet, if you're willing too stop here! The service was great. The food was amazing. We had calamari and chicken potstickers as our entrees. They were phenomenal! I had ordered orange chicken I believe, and my boyfriend had ordered the beef and broccoli. The servings are huge, I couldn't even finish my meal. The food is definitely worth the price. We had gotten our own bottle of wine, two actually. One to sip on as we ate and one to go. Our waiter was very attentive and polite. The overall ambience was very comfortable and modern. 10/5 I would come here frequently. I suggest the calamari, chicken potstickers, and orange chicken. The beef and broccoli was excellent but I simply like chicken better
Clean friendly atmosphere. Staff is helpful and upbeat.  The food is excellent.  Will make Big Bowl a regular stop.

Ordered the veggie potstickers and pad Thai. Probably the worst Thai food I've had. In both dishes you could taste the oil! The potstickers had accumulated oil and I couldn't even eat 2 without being disgusted. The pad Thai barely had any vegetables and was tasteless (except for tasting like oil)  I would definitely not recommend this place. Unfortunately I couldn't send it back because I ordered it to go!

This was my first experience here but the service was extremely good! I had the chicken/peanut egg rolls and then the shrimp/scallops and everything was top notch. Things were fairly priced and delicious.

Big Bowl is pretty good. I came here with friends for one of their birthdays as we spent the weekend in Chicago. Apparently him and his wife always come here so of course the group had to stop by. I'm glad we did. The food is flavorful, tender, and not dry. The staff was very nice and the atmosphere was pretty chill and cool.  I didn't order an appetizer of my own but I tasted the potstickers. They were pretty good. Nothing special but they were not bad.  I ordered the Panang Curry Chicken. As I said earlier it was flavorful and not dry. What I mean by dry is the chicken wasn't dry. Sometimes with restaurants when they serve that thinly sliced chicken it's over cooked, but with Big Bowl that was not the case. The curry was the perfect spice level and seasoned well. The chicken and rice was tender and both were cooked perfect. The rice was nice and fluffy. The curry itself had lots of flavor. The extra add in ingredients like the peas and peppers were nice as well.  Overall, I enjoyed big bowl and would suggest them to others. For a quick Asian spot that wasn't super upscale, the food was pretty good.
Most delicious Sichuan noodle bowls ever! Mongolian beef a close second. And tasty mojitos to boot. This place will get you feeling right! Much love...

The food here is really good. Stir fry is a must have. I like the stir fry with kung pao sauce, also the scheswan sauce is good. The Thai curry is also worth having. The staff is good. Overall a good place to have dinner.
My friends and I came in for a quick bite after work. The waitstaff was very attentive and friendly. Great Food & Big Portions.... Yummy.
Food was alright. Chicken wasnt properly cut on my Panang Curry. The server was a bit of an air head but also hovered too much.

Have enjoyed going to and getting carry out from Big Bowl for years and always great. Favorite Dish: Stir fry bar, chef's choice, with salmon, brown rice and the Sichuan sauce (spicy and delicious).  The green beans appetizer is really good too.  half priced bottles of wine on Monday too
We are locals and this is one of our favorite places to eat. Great food and service.  The manager Michael went out of his way to make our last dining experience great!
Excellent vegetable roll, yummy calamari. I tried their freshly made ginger ale and loved that too. I'll be back!

Wish I remembered my server's name- he was great. Very attentive and had food brought out extremely fast. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated. Staff was very young in general, semi-hipster I'd say. Food was AMAZING. Manager even brought out a complimentary tiny cucumber salad because I was a first time customer. I had the panang curry which always destroys my super sensitive stomach but tasted incredibly going down. The chicken was the most tender chicken I've ever had in a curry.

Had a craving for Asian food, so found this place on Yelp. I went there two days in a row, and tried few things, from their Pad Thai, to the Summer rolls, and their beef dish. In general, the food was good, although some were salty, and the "fusion-ness" makes it different from the more authentic restaurants I have been to; it may be an acquired taste. Their seasonal wheat beer, however, is splendid.

Went in here to get a bite to eat before hitting the night scene. As I walked in I had to get the hosts attention because they had their back turned. I told them it was just me and they offered for me to sit at the bar. So I did.  The bartender was Trey. He didn't greet me right away which was a warning sign. He was washing some glasses right in front of me. Anyways, he finally got my drink order. I ordered the strawberry sangria. The description sounded great. Took a sip of it, and unfortunately it wasn't anything to rave about. It tasted like strawberry syrup. Had a weird consistency too. I was ready to order my entree and I told Trey. He must not have heard me because he went on to do other things even though he shook his head. I waited another 5 min and then had to flag him down again. I was finally able to order the orange chicken. It was pretty good!  Sadly, Trevor never checked on my to see if everything was ok. I put my credit card in the glass in front of me signaling I was ready to pay. He came and took payment. I have to say for Big Bowl being part of Lettuce Entertain You I expected them to hire friendly staff. Trevor has a very dry personality. Also wished he checked on his guest more. It wasn't busy at all.

The ambiance and atmosphere was very nice. I totally was in love with look. The server was well trained and knew the right questions to ask. I order the Mongolian beer for dinner it was amazing and delicious. My wife's food was cook correctly but the  combination ingredients did not mix well together. My wife had the chicken pad Thai. Happy Eating.!!
Enjoyed steaming hot stir fry fresh off of the Wok! Selected our own vegetables.  Great service from Julia. Manager presence on the floor. Very prompt service.

This Americanize Fusion Asian food is designed to cater to those who can't handle any additional spices or too much flavor. The food was decent, but it certain wasn't something I couldn't wait to get up and have seconds on.  Sigh... The style of the restaurant and menu will require those who expect flavor to go the extra mile and clearly stress that during their order otherwise what you will get is a bland surprise. This is the first time I've had curry that tastes bland but there is a first time for everything, isn't there? I've had their food before and it wasn't as bad as it was this evening so either there is a new chef or someone in charge has a bad cold and can't tastes or smell their food enough to know when they have put too much seasoning or not enough.   Either way, I'm never ordering take out from them again maybe I will order inside of the restaurant and explain I don't want American I want spicy.

This restaurant is always reliable, the food & drinks are always good. If it's your first time & not sure what to get, would recommend to go with days specials, which includes suggestions for appetiser, entree & drinks. (It is a large menu) The price is pretty affordable, specially for the area, & the service is always great. The last two times we had a server by the name of Sam. One of the best servers we've encountered (..& we eat out a lot). He's efficient, timely, knowledgeable & passionate about food, which is great if one works in the gastronomic industry. Ask for Sam & enjoy!!
A very safe option as the food is quite tasty and it is reasonably priced. It is usually busy during weekends so reserve in advance. I loved the panang curry.

Keep coming back for extensive Asian gluten free menu. We take out from here a lot, pad Thai and Fresno pepper chicken are our staples. Their service is a bit drab but we don't dine with them a lot too.

My husband and I ALWAYS stop here when in Chicago! It's our fave! Get the build your own stir fry! I got it for the first time and it was awesome! I always get the pad se ewe (sp?) and it's amazing as well! I never got the stir fry in the past because I'm a total introvert and didn't get how it worked...in case you're the same, I'll tell ya! After ordering it with the waiter he'll give you a slip. Take the slip up there and grab a red bowl next to all the veggies. Grab a pair of tongs which are also by the veggies. Use the same tongs for all your veggies and fill your bowl! At the end of the veggie bar there is a counter. Set the bowl on the counter on top of the slip. There is also a place to put your used tongs! That's it! Walk away! lol the teriyaki is really good too!

VERY surprised that the ratings are as high as they are. I came with a couple of friends and got to try a number of dishes, and I was not impressed. To start off we had lemonades and pomegranate ginger ales. The lemonades were very much on the overly tart side, and the ginger ale oddly tasted like medicine. No bueno. To start, we had edamame, chicken egg rolls, and calamari. They were all okay, nothing special.  I ordered the panang chicken curry, one person got the pad thai, and another did a build-your-own stir fry. My panang was unlike any other I've ever had. First of all, there were peas in it. One big sign of major inauthenticity. But the flavor was all wrong--far too peanutty-- and the curry wasn't smooth. The chicken was rubbery, and overall it was not very enjoyable. I tried the pad thai, and it was actually worse. There was oddly a ton of cilantro in it and no Thai basil to be found. Definitely a different flavor than I was expecting for pad thai. I've had worse, but I've certainly had better.

Had Vegetable Pad Thai Curry, with white rice and Tofu, tasted awesome, with the right amount of salt and spice level. The curry flavor was fantastic! Definitely recommend for someone looking to eat mildly spicy meal with rice.
Very soy sauce heavy on the beef and broccoli.  Same heavy soy sauce on the sesame chicken.
Business trip. Big bowl dinner. Awesome Ginger shrimp and scallops with fried rice. Mixed dumplings (2 veg / 2 chicken) and fantastic mai tai that bartender made. Excellent bar service.

I used to go to the location in the viagra triangle but they have since been closed. I came here for lunch on an early Saturday afternoon and of course they were busy with tourists visiting the city. However, I was able to be seated pretty quickly near a window so I could watch people walk by on this winter day. My waiter was attentive and took my order pretty quickly. I ordered the stir fry bowl with chicken vegetables and oyster sauce made to order. It was delicious and not too sweet which is exactly what I was looking for. I really enjoy eating at these locations because you can make several options healthy. I gave it 3 as opposed to 4 stars because even though it was good, it is not a place I would recommend to someone looking for a unique experience or non-commercial dining.
I always enjoy coming here. Both service and product rate a solid 4. The hot and sour tasted unique but satisfying.  Everything on the menu is terrific. Solid and most of all, consistent.
Great ambience and good fresh food . Service is a little slow but overall experience is satisfactory /

On our way to a movie, we had a little over an hour so we stopped in.  Our server was friendly and offered to go over the menu with us, which was nice.  We ordered 4 things and really only enjoyed 2 of them. The dumpling combo : 3 veg 3 chicken. The chicken were plump and warm but the veggie were cold. Plus they were delivered in a pool of sauce that made them soggy and they began to fall apart. Shrimp summer roll: the ingredients were light and summery, but the roll was not rolled tightly- every piece fell apart.  Spicy Sichuan Green Beans: easily The Best Item we tried!! The green beans were crisp and moist, full of flavor and not at all greasy!! Delicious!! Thai Hot Pepper with shrimp: this dish was warm and the flavors worked nice together, but the ratio of rice to protein/veg was off. There was twice as much rice. The picture I took shows the mound of rice, and the mixture has been poured on top of the rice. We couldn't finish it because there was so. much. rice. It was good, but I don't believe I will be back.

Stopped in for a bowl of the Panang Curry Chicken, which I crave on a regular basis and it was delicious as usual! The service at this Big Bowl was particularly impressive, all of the staff treated us like we were royalty. We added in a lettuce wrap appetizer and were not disappointed.

I didn't realize this place was a chain, but it was still good! The Kung Pai Beef was yummy, and the service was great. Only 4 stars because I prefer local restaurants, but if you're looking to try something different this is a good place to go.

Went there on a whim. Early on a Friday afternoon. Best decision ever  Can't wait to go back tonight. The ginger ale w/pomegranate.  Fabulous. I had the calamari. Done right. Ribs delish.  My partner had penang curry. Large portions I had the pineapple chicken I  think. We were very happybwith the service, food, atmosphere. Nice looking dining room clean

This place is a great Asian Fusion type of restaurant.  The service is legit and the staff are very well mannered and prompt.  We always make time to visit this restaurant when we come into the city.  I highly recommend the Chicken Curry Panang Nun.

WOW- Good food - and appetizers - Great blood orange sangrias. There didn't seem to be as big of a selection as we would've thought on the menu- but it was lunch time so maybe dinner has more to choose from. Anyways the portions are huge and you definitely get your moneys worth. 3 stars mostly on service because we were seated forever with minimal visits from our server...basically had to be aware of where the server was to get his attention to get our check...sat there stalking him with my eyes for 10 minutes before i got his attention to get the check. But that wouldn't stop me from returning again as the food was very good.

My third night in Chicago I had to work late and didn't really feel like getting dressed to go out for dinner so I placed an order to-go. I got the Kung Pao Chicken and for some reason it just hit the spot. Totally not what I was expecting.  When traveling, I usually try to eat at places that would have dishes that I would not be able to find at home, and because I eat plenty of rice dishes at home, I don't normally eat what I call pseudo-Chinese food, but this was the perfect amount of fat, grease, veggies, and spiciness. I got the stir-fry with the fried rice, I would recommend plain old jasmine rice because the stir-fry was salty and the fried rice made it worse. But overall, I would come back knowing that it's a reliable place that I could my greasy pseudo-Chinese food fix.

I went here a couple months ago while I was on vacation in Chicago... Best Thai I've ever had! House made dumplings were fantastic, pad Thai (which is what both the manager and server recommended) with chicken was ridiculously delicious and well-portioned, the martinis were perfect. Could not have had a better experience because of one thing though- the service was incredible from start to finish. The hostess was friendly as was the manager who stopped by multiple times with useful information and smiles, but the real treat was Francesco's service.  I've been in the industry for almost 10 years and this man was the best server I've EVER had ANYWHERE from Boston to Miami to Chicago. I won't go fully into detail to spare you the shop talk, but he hit every single point of service you could ask for in a white table cloth restaurant (which this wasn't). He had at least 4 or 5 tables that I could count and approached every one professionally, proficiently, and with a genuine desire to be right there in that moment talking to YOU. Not to mention I ordered two martinis and both were at my table in less than 3 minutes- kudos to him and the bartenders! They say you don't need to have good food to bring back guests, just good service. This place had great service, incredible food, and wonderful ambience with an open kitchen. I'll be back!

Very disappointed, we had a party of 3 and all 3 of us were upset. I ordered the sesame chicken for  $14.95ish and the chicken was little hard nuggets of breading. Tiny little breaded pieces, I found 2 acceptable chunks of chicken in my whole dish. You get more chicken meat in a 4 piece McDonald's chicken nuggets meal than I got in my entire $14 dish. I highly wish we would have went somewhere else. I'm leaving hungry because I couldn't even finish the bowl of noodles and breading chunks.
Vegetarians looking for good Chinese / Thai food, try this place! My favorites -  green curry, crispy garlic tofu & spicy sichuan green beans.

I was treating my Godaughter for her birthday and wanted to go some place different than the norm and somewhere that I've never been. So despite the reviews, I decided to come here. I enjoyed every minute of my dining experience. We were seated right away and our waiter was very helpful and offered plenty of info for it being our first time there. For an appetizer, I ordered the Sichuan String beans....OMG, they were spicy, but delish! For my main eats, I ordered the make your own stir fry....I put almost every vegetable that was offered, chose the Shanghai Mushroom Ginger Garlic sauce added the shrimp and brown rice.. Man, I was beyond satisfied!! Not only were the veggies a hit with the sauce, but they were not skimpy on the shrimp at all which is always a major plus!! For dessert, we ordered the chocolate banana wontons....simply heavenly made! I'm glad I decided to come here and won't hesitate to come back!

I'm going to start out saying how great the service is here. As soon as we walked in the manager, Mike brought us to a quiet table in the corner and asked our drink order while letting us know some staff favorites as we were undecided on what we wanted. Quickly after we ordered our server Sean brought over our drinks and went over the specials. Being our first time it was nice how both Mike and Sean were so patient and thorough while going over all of the specials and taking the time to answer all of our questions which we had a ton of.  For our order we got the peanut spicy noodles and the dumpling platter. My husband who lived in china for 6 months can be a bit picky about his dumplings but even he said they were awesome. My favorite were the spicy peanut noodles (they are cold just so you know when you order and you expect them to be warm).  Once we ordered the timing of the apps and dinner were spot on. I was amazed at how fast they would clear every bit of trash or old plates off our table. Again, this is going back to my initial statement of how great the service was.  Dinner I had the pad sew ew and husband had the chefs choice stir fry both of which were fabulous. My husband went with spicy and boy the stir fry had a kick, which was perfect for his liking.  All in all we had such a fun date night at this spot and as I mentioned earlier it was mostly due to the staff. Mike and Sean made us feel like family and like we were the only table at the place.  The food was good too but it was the service that made the food taste even better. Thanks we will be back!!

Really enjoyed my experience at Big Bowl for many reasons. We were seated immediately on a busy Friday night which is always a plus, and the menu had various options from Japanese food to Thai. I stuck with my usual chicken pad Thai and had the fresh pomegranate ginger ale which went perfectly together. The environment is also relaxing and hip. Prices are also great! Definitely recommend!

Very bad example of asian noodles... Pho is cold, noodles over cooked, and nothing like the real one. Hot Sour soup with tons of corn starch, so thick it couldn't be swallowed. Asked for a side of lime, and they gave us the driest  of the limes. Couldn't take a single drop of juice. Now, is it all because we are from San Francisco where all the asians are and the good produces are?? Or we just came to a bad restaurant??  You let me know....

I went there with a group of six. We made a reservation and asked if the accepted the Lettuce Entertain You gift cards which they said yes to. I called again before arriving to confirm the accepted the gift cards, they said yes. When we got there we showed the hostess the gift cards and she said they do accept them. We are not from the area and we're just given the gift cards as a gift but needed to use them at one of the Lettuce restaurants. We were told three times that they accepted the gift cards and once after the hostess looked at them and confirmed that they do.  We ordered drinks from the bar and since there were six of us we did the group special for 22.95 or something like that per person and we paid extra for beef under the impression we could use the gift cards. When the bill came our waiter told us they were holiday special gift cards and could only be used during specific hours. We said we weren't from the area and that's why we asked three times even showing the gift cards to the hostess once to triple check if they accepted them, and our waiter still said no. We asked to speak to the manager and he told us the same thing. We asked since the hostess did look at the gift card and confirm that they accepted it if he could just take the gift card amount off our bill or give us a discount, and he said there was nothing he could.  The food was very good and the bar drinks were delicious. Our server (don't remember his name) was also really cool and a great server. But the manager should have compensated us a small amount for the mix up because we did ask twice before going, and showed them to someone at the restaurant who confirmed they do accept it. And again, we were not from the area and don't know how the Lettuce Entertain You system works.
Very nice Chinese food! Lot of options! I loved the make your own bowl options! I will visit again!
A very nice upscale environment above average food a good recommendation for dinner or lunch. A slight bit pricey but we go often son grin and bear the price and enjoy
I had the dumplings and teriyaki chicken fried rice and both of it where really good. I would recommend a friend to visit this place.

We have been coming to Big Bowl for years and I'm just now getting around to writing a review.  Food- we ordered two dishes to split between 3 adults and it was more than enough. In every city I go to, I'm always on the hunt for the best pad Thai and I would say this is pretty close if not it. The chicken pad Thai had just the right amount of spice, fresh and vibrant looking veggies, and lots of fresh lime flavor to the dish. There was no over powering fish sauce or too much of any one ingredient and the dish wasn't sticky which is one of my pet peeves with pad Thai - overall the ingredients were included in just the right proportions. We then did the stir fry bar (pick your own veggies, protein, sauce and base of noodles or rice) with tofu, veggies, and coconut green curry sauce. The bar of veggies is pretty impressive and there's definitely an art to cramming all that you want into the medium sized bowl they provide. Pretty epic dish- the sauce was so tasty and coconutty, complete with all your preferred veggies and perfectly stir fried tofu.  Ambience- big restaurant, pretty noisy most of the time but accommodates a lot of guests with a mix of large/small booths and tables. Decor is colorful and nice and fits well with the overall theme of Thai/Chinese fusion.  Service- I have had the full spectrum from great servers to horrendous. The hostesses really need hugs or something as well, they always look pretty miserable to be at work. We asked for fortune cookies from the hostess on the way out and she looked at us like we had asked her for a couple hundred bucks.  bad service at a restaurant is kind of a downer. This is the main reason why they fall to a 4 star in my book. At any rate, the food is what keeps me coming back. Wish they had one of these in Ohio!

What a rip off. Paid $14.85 for an order of Panang Curry Chicken. Got a box completely full of white rice and about 1 tablespoon of sauce. Also got 3 pieces of chicken about half the size of a chicken mcnugget.  Much better options out there for take out curry.  Never again.

We ordered takeout from here twice while I was being treated at NW hospital. Over the two trips we tried the green curry, mongolian beef, cashew chicken, summer rolls, and chicken peanut egg rolls. We were happy with the entrees and indifferent to the appetizers. The portions (of everything) are HUGE. You can easily get two meals out of the entrees. The meals marked spicy on the menu are very spicy, so I modified mine to a medium spice, which was perfect. My husband didn't modify his cashew chicken and regretted it. Overall a good spot for fresh made to order asian food.

Came here with a friend for dinner. The place was very busy but we didn't have to wait long to be seated. The menu had many different dishes to pick from. The food was fine but I was not impress.  The drink special was great on a Friday night! With many good places to eat in Chicago, I don't see myself coming back again.

I wish I could give 0 stars. The food is beyond nasty. I ordered the orange chicken and its taste was less than satisfying. The crab Rangoon tastes like it been fried in someone's behind. My friend and I couldn't stomach a lick so we had to succumb to a Hershey's chocolate bar. SAVE YOURSELF and DO NOT order from this easy bake oven of fake food. Waste of money...would rather have McDonalds.

The food is awful. I got the sweet and sour shrimp and it is so orange-y in flavor it's inedible. I would rather eat Panda Express. My bf got the pho and the large portion says it feeds 3 ppl but it is the size for one.  I paid $16 for my shrimp and I'm so sad $16 down the drain. P.s. I am Asian and this restaurant is not Asian-approved
Yuuuuuge portions of food.  If we would've known the size of our entree's (Pad Thai and Green Curry), we would have split one.  The service was nice and the atmosphere was comfortable.
Had we not been starving and in the mood for pad thai I'd give this place 2 stars, but the meal did the job for what we were craving.
Ok Chinese, a little bland. Had chicken pan-fried potstickers, and Mongolian scallops. Great server!!

I'm a big fan of Teriyaki Fried rice chicken  dish. This time the whole dish tasted like burned food. Having said that to the server, he called the manager. I thought as all restaurants do, we won't have to pay for it. He just looked us in the eye and refused to do anything about it. So, we ended up paying for a burned dish with no apologies what so ever!!

Nothing really that special nor unusual is found here. As a meeting place for four on business it worked just fine.  I would say I enjoyed the decor and service far more than the food. The contemporary atmosphere is very pleasant with an ever so lightly touch of Asian influences inclusive of bamboo light shades is a nice touch. Nice use of art as well.  I guess it's a local or regional chain which might rain a lot.
Went to the bathroom and saw roaches crawling on the wall.  Wish I would have noticed it before we ate. Pretty gross.

The food is edible but I will never order from there again. Dumplings- more like wannabe perogies - the skin is too thick Soup- I couldn't eat more than a bite, the flavor was lacking  Kung pap chicken- it was ok only because that's fried and hard to mess up.  Too greasy.

Got a delivery through amazon. My order of pad thai was almost inedible. It gave off both smell and look of salmon gone bad. Considering it was twice as much as thai places around the city, I was very disappointed. My girlfriend ordered kung pao chicken and that was maybe 2.5 a half stars as far as dish quality goes. Also overpriced. I recommend going with a different place if you have a choice.
This place is a treasure in Chicago. Food is really good and the ambience is perfect for a quick delicious lunch. Chinese and Thai food. Love it. I will definitely come back
Great!  Not one issue!  Great. Solid food. Excellent service. Try the sesame chicken or 7 flavor chicken. The Kung Po Chicken is really good but the other dishes are awesome.
Food was ok. Not great and not bad. Vegetarians in our party really loved it. I had chicken satay and dumplings.

I really love their fried rice, in particular their BBQ pork. The teriyaki chicken fried rice is also delicious. I like their orange chicken as well but my boyfriend wasn't as big of a fan. The prices are moderate and now they deliver via Grubhub, which will probably be bad for my wallet as well as my waistline. When I'm craving fried rice, I think this is going to be one of my go-to places from now on.

What happens when non-Asians try to make Asian food? Wait for about an hour and your noodle dinner will arrive. The vegetables are crispier than at an Asian-staffed place and the overall seasoning is more bland. If you want to see why Apple can't make iPhones in the U.S. come here around 7 pm midweek and watch and wait and wait for your food...
Absolutely Terrible if you like to ruin your weekend with an upset stomach, then by all means go there. Still currently sick and will never recommend Big bowl to anyone!

Consensus among our group: the pad Thai smells/tastes like burnt dog shit, the Moscow Muel smells/tastes the way a port-a-potty freshener smells. I would give zero stars if I could. Our waitress was fantasist though. She was attentive and sweet.

It was ok. A little on the meh side, but ok nonetheless.  The picture below is of their scallop and shrimp number. I ate it, but the entire time I couldn't stop thinking about how the sauce was so overwhelming yet underwhelming at the same time (if you know what I mean). I can't put my finger on the infringing ingredient, but whatever it was they could stand to go without it. Making matters worse, the rice was basically soaking in a pool of the sauce; it was just too much. I wanna say he infringing ingredient in the sauce was soy sauce. This dish might be better suited for someone who has an adventurous and curious palate.  Anyway, the service was decent. I sat at the bar and got  the kind of service you'd expect at the bar.  Overall, it wasn't bad, but it would've been better without all that dreadful sauce. I'd come back, but I'd stir clear of that dish.

I came here with a large group and the food was underwhelming. The vegetable dumplings were soggy and fell apart when you picked them up. The chicken potstickers were a high note and were crispy and tasty. The noodles were generally overcooked and mushy. The one fantastic area was the desserts- both the chocolate cake and cheesecake were amazing.

Very surprised on the service here. Food was very good and I highly recommend it. However the service here is what brought this down to Two stars. You would think with all the servers on and the management that stood directly in front of me service would be better. I ordered a drink, watermelon sangria, of which I didn't really like. Left without the server asking if the drink was ok or even if the food was ok. I got the simple service, the basics. Very displeased on the lack of not wanting to solve the problem that they didn't know because, talking to your coworkers was more important. And the smart remark on the way out was wow !!! Came here last year and had great service I guess today was not the day I should have come in.

I'm a big fan of Big bowl and this location. Located in the heart of downtown near Michigan avenue. This place always fills my veggie/ protein quota. I like to think that when I eat here it is a healthy choice and forget about all the extra added sauces. You can dine in and take advantage of the nice atmosphere or double park with your hazards on and take it to go like I did this time. It's usually only about a 15 min wait after ordering anyway. They have a nice small bar near the front door with TVs for your wait. The food is always good and the service is friendly. At times it can get crowded and the wait is longer. The hostess even brought the food outside to my car to me. That alone was an extra star. I recommend this place.

This place was close to our hotel so we gave it a shot. It's a nice restaurant that had good ambiance and great customer service. I had a Thai noodle dish and asked for it to be spicy. I wish I hadn't because it turned out way too spicy. My husband had the orange chicken and was not impressed. We tried the egg rolls as appetizers and were satisfied with them.

I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service here. I had low expectations because I'm not big on eating at chains and I am used to real asian food from Chinatown or my home, not Americanized/Asian inspired. HOWEVER, I thoroughly enjoyed my schezuan green beans (spicy just as I'd hoped/expected they would be) and the Asian salad. The servings were quite large which is nice due to (slightly) expensive menu prices. The staff was great. We felt really catered to. As mentioned before I don't really like to eat at chains, but I wouldn't mind going back here again!

Came here because my friend recommended this place and absolutely loved it. The service was excellent , food was something different but still really good. Love the setting and environment. our server was very attentive and for everything  that we asking, he was the bomb! thanks for make my first experience phenomenal.
Recently had dinner with the family and it fantastic! Food was good and the waitstaff was attentive without being distractive.

Absolute garbage! Ordered delivery (2x with the second being an accident because we didn't remember the terrible experience before). At 15 dollars per entree, I expect more than a Tupperware container FULL of white rice and approximately 2 pieces of chicken. Moreover the food itself is extremely mediocre. Never. again.

Unfortunate experience at Big Bowl this afternoon. This is not the first time the restaurant has been disappointing for take out. I ordered a couple of Thai Hot Pep (Shrimp) and can attest that it was the driest thai dish I have ever eaten (no sauce whatsoever). I couldn't find any cilantro either.  My motivation to write this review goes beyond missing ingredients. There was just no finesse in the dish. The fried shrimp were clumped together in a big mass (like one would have fried a ball of frozen battered shrimp) and the dish just didnt come together.  I expect better from the LEU group. Won't be bringing any of my friends here anymore.

So bummed we are here while in Chicago.  I remembered Big Bowl being so much better.  My husband and I ordered the chicken lettuce wraps and the chicken pad Thai.  Both were unimpressive.  The PAd Thai did not have much flavor and was not spicy at all.  It also seemed to be drowning in oil.  The lettuce wraps were more veggies than anything and I definitely prefer Pf Changs.  We probably won't be back to a Big Bowl anytime soon.   On a post ice note, out waiter was super friendly and very attentive.
Never ordering from here again. Total rip off. $30 and got maybe 2 pieces of beef and 4 pieces of the chicken. The rest was all onions and mushrooms.

Yikes Big Bowl what happened?? I used to love Big Bowl and the food was always delicious. The panang curry was my favorite dish! The last few times I had visited the service was really spotty. I decided to opt for carry out. I ordered the panang curry with chicken and it was horrible! The chicken was rubbery and not edible. The sauce didn't seem to be the same either. I hope Big Bowl can get their act together but after this visit I will not be back.

Big Bowl is quick and casual- great for lunch.  Service was wonderful, our server was attentive, informative, and very quick with our food and check.  My husbands meal (vegetarian dumplings) was great.  My pad Thai was nothing special.  The portion size was huge but the flavor was a little off, there wasn't quite enough sauce for the noodles.  Pad Thai is a test for any Thai restaurant and very few get it perfect.  Still the food was fresh, the draft beer was cold, and service was perfect.
Had a good meal here ... The stirfry options are the best to suit our exact level of spiciness.. The ambience s cheerful and relaxing...

One positive thing I will start with is their delivery was fast! However, the food that followed was a disappointment. My boyfriend and I ordered carryout through amazon prime because I had a $20 credit from shopping on Prime day and this was one of the restaurants that qualified....we were in the mood for Chinese so we went for it.  I took a few bites and unfortunately I had to throw my meal away. It just did not taste fresh and smelled odd. The flavors also were pretty nasty. I ordered orange chicken with a side of fried rice and he ordered the BBQ pork fried rice. He ate more than I did, and said it was "ok" but he definitely didn't get close to finishing it. His fried rice tasted completely different than mine, and not because of the BBQ pork...it was a little fresher. Mine literally tasted like it sat in the trash. I hate giving poor reviews for places too. The delivery was quick and I appreciated the fortune cookies thrown in. Maybe I just got the wrong dish.

Where to start! With the mediocre food lacking flavor or spice? With the globby pad thai noodles that stick together? Nah- I'll start with the service. They have a take out window, which I decided to go to because I had a lot of work to get done. What a great option, right? As E-40 would say, NOPE!  I ordered, things were a bit pricey, but seemed Ok. Fast forward over thirty minutes, no food. I checked with the woman at the counter, got lots of attitude, but still no food. Eventually, I received the bag. Got home, and found- 1. No chopsticks, soy sauce, chile sauce, or anything else that was said to be included 2. The wrong order! Ordered the peanut sauce curry chicken, but the resulting dish was not even close. I was too far to bring back by the time I noticed, so take my money this once Big Bowl- for you will never be taking it again. I had to eat the meal with coffee stirrers! Really tested my skill with chopsticks, but was not what you hope for in a meal. Not at all, my friends (I'm in a hotel, no silverware). How do I really feel, you may ask? Disappointed. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, PSYCHE I'm never going back.
Good place.   But very loud. very poor taste in the music being played + speakers not appropriate for a large restaurant  Maybe be best if the music was shut out or better music payed

My group and I decided to eat at big bowl because it was super close to the hotel we were staying at. The food was good and the decor interesting. I highly recommend you try one of their home brewed lemonade a or ginger ales, both were very good. To all those Pokemon trainers out there, the restaurant itself is a pokestop. Depending on where you're sitting you can be in range of two and just take in items while you enjoy your meal.
Nice food and drinks but the servers could do a better job. The place is too crowded - especially over the weekends. The place is too noisy.

Big Bowl.. This place blew me away as soon as I tried the edamame. The service for the most part was pretty outstanding other than him taking like 10 minutes to bring our check back. But needless to say it was the most bombenist Chinese I've ever consumed.

I went here for lunch and was in a hurry, I told the hostess that I was and she related to the waitress which in turn relayed that to the coach and my food was out in minutes! This is rare, trust me. Very friendly, clean, fast, okay priced for downtown.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

This time one star for their carryout. Kids who work there!  We asked them not to cut our summer roll. The kid said it didn't fit in the container. So as a result, we got a giant long thing with no sauce, no nothing.

Didn't have a great time here. Cool place and all, but if you're starving and really want to chow down and taste great food then this might not be the best choice. Everything tasted so bland and required a lot of salt just to try and help give it some taste.

My office has ordered lunch from here twice now. Both times the food has been hot, delicious, and packaged securely (we really appreciate this for delivery!). I've had the broccoli beef two times and it's super tasty. You can tell the ingredients they use are high quality and the rice is delicious! Highly recommend, although be warned it's quite pricey for the portion size.
Food is always hit or miss honestly. Never know what I'm going to get and sadly tonight was a miss. Don't know why I keep trying. Going to give up on this place
Awesome food and great service. Im a vegetarian and i love the kung pao noodles with veggies and the flavored ginger ales

Just had a great meal at Big Bowl.  Appetizers of crab Rangoon and canton ribs in teriyaki sauce. Both had great flavor. I ordered the shrimp and scallop in ginger sauce for dinner with jasmine rice. It was a generous portion that I couldn't finish and I wanted too so badly. Rice cooked perfectly, lots of shrimp and scallops which tasted awesome. Try the orange ginger ale to wash it all down, and apple spring rolls with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce for dessert. Our server was really friendly and checked on us often. Service was great and food came out fairly quickly. I didn't give 5 stars because they need to do something about their curb appeal. It has none. If it wasn't for the fact that my granddaughter was looking for rice, we wouldn't have gone in. We saw the bowl and chop sticks and figured it out.  Glad we did!

Ever since the Big Bowl location on Cedar street has closed, big bowl on Ohio street has been my to go place! Great food and service. My favorite dish is always the chicken pad Thai and the chicken potsticker appetizer! The only thing I have noticed is that food portions have greatly deceased.

Had a great meal here with my girlfriend last week. Mike, the manager, set us up in a window table and everything tasted fantastic. We had a few cocktails, the mai tai's and Shanghai Mule were delicious, not too sweet but definitely packed a punch.

First, the negative stuff:  delivery from here - i think they use Dining Inn or CEO - is hit or miss, depending on what driver is assigned your food. But mostly, it's a miss.  I usually end up ordering carry-out and walking it home. It's so much quicker than waiting hours for food that ends up being lukewarm by the time it gets to you. 2. what happened to the summer rolls??? more importantly, what happened to the pad thai noodles and the tasty, light sauce that they were made in?  The last time I got a shrimp one, it was filled with peanuts and some kind of dreck-like green shredded vegetable that was way past its use-date.  It tasted like someone scraped together the remnants from the bottom of a food processor and threw them into the rolls.   The shrimp was fine, the wrapper was fine, but the noodles were gone and so was the sauce. It's completely tasteless unless you slather it in peanut sauce, which I don't like to do.   Same goes with the vegetable rolls, which in the past, they would occasionally switch up to include asparagus or cucumbers or avocado.  Now the summer rolls have this fried tofu stick inside them with again, NO NOODLES?! Why did they have to go and mess up the recipe?  That fried tofu inside what was once a light appetizer reminded me of the crap they used to sell at the Taipei 7-11 stores that I frequented during Junior Year Abroad.    The positives:  Nice managers, friendly servers and bussing staff.  Very tasty steamed chicken dumplings, fresh stir-fry bar, and flavorful Beef Chow Fun noodles.

Very American style Thai and Chinese food.  Nothing like the real thing ordered the yellow curry and it was nothing like a real Thai restaurant. Definitely would not return or recommend food was blah.

By far one of the homiest places I visited. From bartender to manager to server to greeter, great service with a smile . I found a new favorite spot. The food is deliciously good. Concept is good the people is what being you back . Came on Saturday and had a blast. Definitely will be back.

One of the worst places I've eaten Chinese in Chicago, or anywhere.  I might have caught them on an off day, but the chicken I received was dark and dry, almost as though it as several days old.  I usually don't like to write negative reviews, but I feel compelled because even though I didn't eat more than a couple of mouthfuls, when I asked for the cheque, the staff didn't even ask why I had not eaten the food.  I was so annoyed, I paid left and didn't say a word.  I don't think any restaurant should be serving that to it's customers.....

They have the best Panang curry chicken i've ever had. You can get it a spicy as you want. Only problem I have is you never get a consistent amount of food in the bowl. Sometimes there's enough to save for later and sometimes there's barley enough to feel you up. I'll always go back just for the consistent flavor.

Just wanted to add another great experience last week where we had two more dishes that were really good.  Off the Thai portion - the Thai Hot Pepper w/ shrimp and the Thai Basil Fragrant Beef.  Both dishes had a great amount of spiciness and kick that we didn't even have to add the chili paste.  I just love that Big Bowl is not scared to really add some flavor and spice to their dishes.  I hate those places where they say something is "spicy", but it never really is.  I applaud Big Bowl for this and that's one of the reasons we keep coming back.  The half price pitchers of sangria on Friday nights don't hurt either!

Ate at this restaurant recently with my daughter and her roommate before going to a movie down the street. We were on a time schedule so we needed something quick. We weren't disappointed. We each ordered something different and shared. The food was fresh, nicely prepared and seasoned, noodles were cooked just right. We boxed up our leftovers (the portions are quite large) and filled the theatre with aromas afterward. Definitely a good place for a quick stop if you're in the mood for Thai or Chinese food.

Just received meal. Did not get Teriyaki sauce or sweet and sour sauce. Food was dry.  No sauces on food. Flavor was lacking. When I called to complain they hung up on me. Then they offered to send the sauces after we ate. Not great customer service.
Delivery service for lunch during the weekend is all automated or you get hung up on also prices online do not reflect.
Great choices of food - all meals hot and very good service and reasonable priced- brought 2 guys for dinner and two days later another one. All 3 loved it and now brand loyal
Great place to eat right off Michigan Avenue. I tried the dumpling soup and the shrimp pad Thai. Highly recommend it!

I'm only giving this place three stars because overall I don't think service was good, not even regular. Food is rich and always fresh. If you have time to deal with horrible waiters, you won't mind coming over here, but if you are strict about it, then don't even bother. Many options to go in the same street/area.
Very good. The pot stickers are awesome!! The sangria with melon was terrific. The service is always top notch.

If you are in the area and need some Thai or Chinese food PRONTO! This is the place to be. I highly recommend  stopping by and grabbing some food even if it's a happy hour snack. The menu is Asian Fusion and the ambiance is quite nice and goes well with the Asian Fusion theme. After shopping we de used to give it a try. The Crab Rangoons are TO DIE FOR! They are a bit pricey from what I'm used to paying for this appetizer, but they are by far the BEST Crab Rangoons that I have ever had. However, they give you 5 for $10.00 and they are small.  We also tried the Yellow Chicken Curry and an extra side of steamed white rice. The curry was not as good as I though it was just okay. The veggies and chicken were good but their curry just had an a jars taste.  We also ordered the Chicken Peanut Egg Rolls and I was not thrilled about them.  They had too many of a peanut taste and it was just not complimenting the roll at all.  So out of the experience, I was just happy with the Crab Rangoons. Might not go back, but if I do I will order their friend rice and give a try to their home made Ginger Ale!

It was time to give Big Bowl another chance and they hit it out of the park with Kung Pao Chicken Noodles.  Big, bright bowl with the bite of ginger and the burn of the peppers, tender chicken, chewy noodles, wrinkled green beans coming together like a symphony in the mouth.
Orderd the following things: Vegetable Pot Stickers - very good Big noodles Kung Pao Tofu - very good
I tried Big Bowl on a whim traveling through Chicago and now I have to go every time I'm In Chicago!!! Best of the best this place is!!! Love every aspect!! Such a delight really!!!!

I really loved this restaurant!  The menu was easy to navigate and I found many vegan options.  I loved the stir fry bar idea and portion sizes were huge.  I came from out of town and it was a wonderful place to find for great food and atmosphere!  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

So sad the Gold Coast location is gone! :( So happy the Ohio St. location is alive and well. The food here is always delicious and relatively healthy, and the servers are always friendly and on their game. I look fwd to Big Bowl as a part of my Chicago experience every time I come. The greens beans are incredible, but honestly I haven't had a dish that isn't highly enjoyable and leaving me wanting a return trip. *Get the Green Beans, Shanghai Chicken and Lettuce Wraps.

If you know what you're getting into (inexpensive, casual Asian) I think Big Bowl does the job perfectly. I had the Pad See Ew and it was awesome, as were the spring rolls and sea salt edamame. They have a really good list of drinks and our server was really sweet. It's nothing fancy, but the food and experience are great for the price.

It was good food overall if you're in the mood for Asian. I would advise that you stay away from the five spice edamame. It's an overload of cumin in your mouth.  Not necessary. Should have stuck to the the classic sea salt. I made my own entree which consisted of salmon, yellow curry and chefs recommended mix veggies. Have to say that was pretty good. My friends got the chicken chopped salad. It looked like a mountain of salad when it came out. Pretty presentation. They seemed to enjoy their meals. The chicken potstickers were good too.

Very interesting atmosphere for a Chinese and Thai restaurant. For a restaurant in downtown Chicago prices were very reasonable. I stayed on the safe side with Beef and Broccoli and it was a hearty portion. I would definitely recommend it
Ordered via diningin and they got my order wrong. I asked for extra spicy and it was mild to the tenth degree. Food was ok otherwise. Subpar Thai.

Food is always delicious. Chicken lettuce wraps are a must every time I dine there. The atmosphere, the service, and energy is great. My friends and I always love visiting big bowl for dinner in the city. I highly recommend checking it out and giving it a shot!

First of all, John W. was such an amazing server, it felt like fine dining. Kudos. I always get a fresh ginger ale, yum! Love the string bean app. Best dish IMO is the Kung Pao with wide noodles & you can sub chicken out for scallops, which you should! Fresh veggies, decadent sauce and carb comfort.  So glad that when the Gold Coast location closed it didn't mean Big Bowl was gone forever!

I ordered the vegi and tofu pad Thai and it comes super salty...OMG I seriously need water to wash off the sause. When it comes. I saw the sauce at the bottom. This is the first time I saw pad thai with source at the bottom.
Kong Pao Chicken noodles I ordered here was the really saltiest food I have ever eaten in the U.S.

Ordered via GrubHub, and the food arrived on time.   Problem is we ordered three dishes between my cousin & I a few days ago, each including chicken as the main protein ingredient. Needless to say, the food was inedible and was thrown-out because all of our (boneless/skinless) chicken pieces were covered in feathers!  You read right.  Feathers!  This can on occasion happen with bad chicken wings, but really!?  In our appetizers & entrees? If you're in the restaurant business, please clean the feathers from your chicken.  This is such a sloppy and unacceptable thing to happen with today's standard in food preparation & safety. Big Bowl refused to refund the order (even when pictures were provided to them of the incident), stating "they only use boneless skinless chicken" at their restaurants, which couldn't be further from the truth.  Get your shit together.  GrubHub, after spending 30 minutes on the phone generously offered me a whole five dollars, (and the credit doesn't even show up in my account) for a failed fifty dollar order.  Really, this isn't acceptable.  I'm disputing this charge with JPMorgan Chase if this is the game the restaurant & GrubHub want to play.  Now both Big Bowl & GrubHub have lost. Don't mess with my food! This was a fifty dollar order.  If I pay good money for my food, I expect good food.  It's a simple philosophy.

Make reservations! We bypassed so many others who were waiting. The pad si ew with chicken was fantastic. They mixed my boyfriend's veggies with someone else's. Sorry to them - he added in a lot of hot peppers and jalapeños!  So they offered us a free dessert for the mistake, which was delicious!!! Like a half baked brownie, and caramel ice cream is amazing.  Our waiter was very nice. I'm sad the bf didn't get his intended dish, but he was still happy and enjoyed it. Their take on crab ragoon is good! Different than your usual Chinese restaurant. I like both, so it's worth trying for a little change!

Today (2/27/16)- I placed my order at 8:30 PM through GrubHub and I was told it'd arrive at 10:00 pm. When the food did arrive, they gave me the wrong order - we had a bunch of veggie stuff, but I got someone else's chicken pad thai and wontons etc etc. On calling back, I was told the restaurant has closed and we won't get our food. This is completely irresponsible. I am disgusted beyond measure - if you see below, they had messed up another order a few months back. Ruined my sat night dinner with friends. NEVER ORDERING AGAIN!  4 months back - Never ever order delivery from Big Bowl. They say 30-45 mins and then take two hours. Very disappointing. Ruined my friday night!
For an American asian restaurant I would say the food is great and pricing is reasonable. Ambience is not too bad. Would eat here again in the near future.

Ohhh...big bowl.It's like Pei Wei if Pei Wei were actually good, or Panda Express minus the excess grease and sodium: My place to go when I can't figure out where else to eat. And generally it is just as expected...if you don't go in with expectations of having genuine asian food, that is.  I almost always go for the stir fry bar - it's set up similar to mongolian BBQ, except that you only pick the veggies. You tell your server what meat and noodles you want ahead of time and go at it!  I would stay away from almost all their appetizers unless you have extra cash hangin' around - while decent, just not the best value.  PS: Also a lettuce entertain you restaurant.

First time here. Not a huge amount of experience with Asian food so will keep to simple pro's and con's.  Pro's : Location good, servers very nice and helpful, portions plentiful and food very tasty. Con's: Can't really say that I experienced any. As I am not an expert,  I  can't say how authentic this food is, but my untrained tummy enjoyed the meal.
just mehh. very chain like food. surprised it's part of the Lettuce family. can get better food elsewhere. service was really good, though!

Sitting in Big Bowl right now. Tried the chicken and peanut egg rolls, pretty good. Had the garlic tofu fried rice, very tasty. Friend the Kung Pow chicken, very good. Overall, a lot of good flavored within the dishes. My server, Lisa was at my table the perfect amount of times, very pleasant.

I don't know where to start but let me tell you one thing about big bowl, you have a lot of eating options here! Located in the glamorous corner off Michigan mile on Ohio Street big bowl is a vibrant up-and-coming Asian fusion restaurant. I had a chance to visit this place on a weekend night for dinner. Naturally this place was jampacked and there was a 30 to 45 minute waiting. While the energetic house music and a low lit romantic atmosphere captivate most of your senses as you enter, I'll be honest my olfactory sense was the most captured by the aroma coming right off the stir frys and the hot woks!  Now that I have created a rather graphic depiction of my experience here, I'll tell you that the menu has a substantial variety. Depends on what you are craving! They have a very decent Thai menu, I hear the curries are very good. I had the Kung Pao chicken served wit rice and Sichuan beef also served with rice. DELICIOUS by every definition!  The service despite how busy this place was, never failed to impress! I'm looking forward to my next trip already #confessionsofayelperatnight #hashtagsdontworkonyelp
Kung pao chicken   Cashew chicken 8/10 Pomagranate gingerale 9/10 Hibiscus leamonade 6/10 Sichuan beef

Oh dear. I ordered their pad Thai, and it was a mistake. The portions were big, there were ample amounts of tofu and veggies, but the rice noodles tasted stale and akin to plastic. I couldn't eat more than one spoonful of the noodles. Don't come here for their pad Thai -- apparently some of their curries were palatable (but someone in our group asked our waiter to swap out the Penang curry with their yellow curry).  The service was impeccable, and our waiter was more than accommodating. However, my experience with the food was sub-par. Tl;dr -- above average portions of below average Chinese and Thai food.

Ate here for the first time yesterday. Food was flavorful and delicious. Ordered the Kung pao chicken with noodles and a side of fried rice because I was indecisive on which would taste better with the chicken. Ultimately the noodles were better, I loved it and would definitely return. Knocked them 1 star for taking longer than initially stated to complete my order. The staff was helpful with their recommendations and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. Overall great experience.

I really enjoy this place, and I go here all the time. They have a decent selection (I wish there were more options), and the food tastes really good. It's on the pricier side of things for a casual restaurant, but the quality of the food and the excellent taste makes it worthwhile to me.  Their chicken potstickers, kung pao noodle (w/ chicken or beef), beef & broccoli, ginger sea scallops & shrimp are all great options. I'm sure the rest are good. My friend typically goes to the stir fry bar. It's a great place to catch up with a friend or take a long-term significant other to eat. I don't think it's necessarily going to impress a first date. Overall great place.

Not sure if it was just what I ordered that was a little unpleasant but I had the Bbq Chicken Fried Rice (don't remember the actual name of the dish) and it wasn't the best Chinese food I've tasted. I've had better fried rice and better bbq chicken from local Chinese diners.

I used to eat here all the time because I worked nearby and I always got the chicken pad thai, which was delish. Fast forward, I'm staying in the neighborhood, house-sitting and am walking by and decide to revisit my favorite dish. Yuck-they've changed it and it tastes nothing like pad thai that I've had anywhere.  It had this weird tomato-ey, hot and spicy aftertaste, --pad thai is not hot and spicy--and again, tasted nothing like any pad thai I've ever had. It was pretty unappealing, but as I explained to the waiter, I was starving and didn't want to wait for something else to be prepared. On top of the unappealing/weird taste, it was totally overpriced. My last time at Big Bowl. : (

We had a gift card and ordered the Panang Curry (will upload picture) and Orange Chicken. Both were excellent. As a Panang Curry lover, it was top notch here at Big Bowl. My fiancé's Orange Chicken was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The hostess and waitress we had were both wonderful, and their winter sangria was fantastic. The only con, if you're a local, is how close to mag mile it is. We happened to be in the area, but this isn't a place I'd commute to from your neighborhood since there are so many great Thai restaurants in the city. However, this is a great spot if you're in the area, and I'd definitely recommend this place!

Asked if they had any happy hour specials. Our server checked and told us that house vodka was $6..... I ordered a vodka on the rocks with a splash of water... Simple enough...bill comes back with an $8 charge for the vodka drink.... When I questioned it, I was told there was an up-charge for being on the rocks!!! Wth?!!! I got charged $1.25 for ice in my glass... The server stated that she would go talk to the manager about taking off the up-charge....fortunate for me, they took off the $1.25.... The drink still came out to be $6.75...... Still trying to understand the whole $6 vodka happy hour charge went.......

The food was delicious, per usual, but staff was awesome. Thank you so much to our server and the staff for being so kind to my friends and me! I had a wonderful time and couldn't have asked for a better start to my birthday weekend!
The bartender kept misunderstanding my order I speak service was mediocre not going back for sure

Was on vacation to Chicago and wanted some good Chinese food so I came across Big Bowl and decided to check them out, first off it was very crowded as it was a Friday night, so had to wait about 15 min for a table, the menu is not that large and your choices are a little limited but overall the quality of the food is top notch service is very good and it definitely has an upbeat trendy feel to the restaurant, but as others have said it is priced a bit high for the amount of food you receive. portion size a bit small and price a bit high.... but considering where it was located it was still acceptable..

Definitely a touristy spot with overpriced food. I got a salad that was drenched in the dressing, should have asked for it on the side. The service was excellent and the ambiance inside was really nice.

I came here with a friend and we ordered the pork dumplings which is good came with a mustard sauce and a sesame sauce. I really like the mustard sauce. We ordered the pad Thai noodle with chicken extra peanuts it was really good and had a kick to it. And my friend ordered the green curry tofu with brown rice. It was good and spicy. Friendly service!

If there was a 6th star , I'd chose it!!! We LOVE this place (seriously we go here at least 3 times a month)! The servers are always great and super nice! The food never fails to amaze, and is always consistent. Great location... (Except for parking)... But some walking is good for the legs.

The food was average and the portion size is disappointing compared to the prices. It seems the only reason it is busy is the proximity with a movie theatre.  We didn't get a table so decided to carry out, the lady taking our order seemed too busy always. Too busy to even call out our names when the order arrived. We waited for a good 40 mins right in front of her, unaware that the order was ready. Only when we decided to take a table instead,we realised the food was lying ready long back.

One of my favorite places to go in downtown and visited more than 30 times.wishing them to improve more in stir-fry bar,they have repetitive items to choose.Wish they add egg and more vegetables to the stir fry place.Old style of  cutting bamboo sticks is good than the new way they are doing this wayNo refills on drinks and regular non-alcoholic drinks are expensive.Food and service is good.Wish they have free parking at least for customers.

Worst place to be I am very disappoint with their way of making stir fry noodles. It had so much sauce more than expected and which was all slurpy and soggy and horrible. The other order we had didn't have enough flavors and it was made extremely spicy. They probably ignore the fact how to cook their noodles it felt like eating noodles in gravy than stir fry noodles very annoyed with their poor service with very expensive food.
Loved this place. Went there with some old classmates (a couple yrs ago and never posted a review), but it's an amazing place, great good. Will go back, one day.

Tasty food but slightly expensive. I love how spicy I can make my bowl and the ability to actively make the exact combination I like. If the bowl didn't cost too much, I'd be back here a lot! The fried shrimp bowl costs around $19 without tax.  The service is great, the waiter checked up on us a lot even though they were busy. We probably needed like 10 water refills because we made our food to spicy. I also love the location (near magnificent mile and AMC theater) and it looks amazing from both the inside and outside!
Basic corporate American Chinese food.  No thanks...

I ordered gluten free orange chicken for dinner tonight and I was very unimpressed especially after all the gluten free raving reviews. My chicken looked liked it had been cut up and boiled. There was no taste to it what so ever, the rice tasted like it was drowned in soy sauce. I was so excited to see gluten free orange chicken on the menu but what's the point if you make a dish that doesn't have any hint of orange.  You're much better of at BrightWok in the loop when looking for gluten free Asian food

My friend and I found our favorite Chinese place here in Chicago. We ordered carry out and it only took about 15min with 2/3 people in front of us.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is great and we would love to visit again for dine-in. The attire is nicer but we saw some people come in with jeans and high school tie-dye shirts and fit in just fine.  The food though. That is where it's at. We ordered the hot and sour soup and the flavored were so intense. Very fresh too!  The beef and broccoli I will order again and again. It tasted just like beef and broccoli should but kicked up a notch! We kept saying, "it's like fancy beef and broccoli."  We also ordered the ginger scallop and shrimp something or other. I can't remember the exact name. But holy smokes it's good! So good! The scallops were cooked to perfection! The ginger was spicy and the ingredients fresh as well.  Our only dislike was the fried rice seemed a bit mushy. But nothing that would keep us away!

Ordered some apps as an afternoon snack.   Veg spring rolls really hit the spot.   Packed with a variety of flavors and textures - outstanding flavor balance where hints of every element pop in your mouth.    Egg rolls are pretty good, but they're size makes them awkward to eat.  They should break the order of two rolls into four to maximize interior and exterior crunch.  The chicken was undetectable but in missed. Veg dumpling was a huge fail.  No flavor whatsoever.  Not even the slightest hint of ginger in the dumpling or the dipping sauce.  Unidentifiable mix of pureed vegetable mush.  No typical element present - ginger, white pepper, sesame oil, scallion, garlic - in the perfectly steamed airy pillow.  The dipping sauce looked promising . . . Devoid of soy, vinegar, chili.  Huge disappointment.

I've been here a few times and have tried several things on the menu. There is a decent drink selection, but this place is good for its fresh food. Although some Asian places' food can be heavy, all of the dishes at big bowl have a lightness to them. You can tell that they use very fresh incredibles in every meal and don't go to heavy on the sauce. I'm a personal fan of the create your own stir fry. You pick all the veggies you want and tell them what sauce and protein you want. After that, they do the rest and it comes out to your table pretty quick.

We have visited Big Bowl a few times and typically try something different each time. The food has been delicious and really fresh. You can watch the chefs make the meals and you can create your own stir fry which is fun! Pretty good drink menu, the peach sangria is yummy! We will be coming back in the future.

I am updating my review.  I originally received my food 1 hour late and cold.  Delivery Wow" is the company they use.  The Big Bowl manager called me and made things right.  He went above and beyond....and for that, I applaud.  I will be back.

Don't go to Big Bowl if you think you're going to celebrate one's birthday in style. That wasn't even the whole issue, though. I brought my two elderly Chinese friends to lunch today, the wife doesn't understand English, but her husband, whose birthday we were celebrating, speaks a little English and has okay understanding if one speaks slowly and clearly.  For appetizers I ordered the potstickers for our table, which the waiter recommended. They were okay, a little greasy since they were fried, but my friends like them. The fried dumplings came with three special sauces, so we all had to more than double dip in the sauces and share germs. Had a waiter been available, I would have requested a spoon to put the sauces on our bread plates. Surprisingly, the soup was served before the appetizers. Common knowledge that an appetizer is served before a meal, I didn't think to specify that when ordering. So when all that food was brought to our table, I quickly told our waiter to hold off on the salads, that we want to have a leisurely lunch. We were there late morning, and I noticed there were plenty of empty tables--no need to rush us through our lunch.   After taking one bite of my squash soup, I saw there was chicken in it. Then the waiter returned to our table and apologized profusely, because I had told him that I have a vegan diet and wanted to know if it contained dairy. Today we learned that one undisclosed, secret ingredient in Big Bowl's featured roast squash soup is poultry. The waiter offered to take my soup away, but did not offer to serve me a new bowl of soup without chicken. Although he did mentioned that option when he brought me the check.  I don't understand why any restaurant would feature "roasted squash soup" on their menu and lead the customer to believe that they were eating a vegetable dish, hiding that one ingredient-- poultry. Because of a mistake like that, a waiter in a classier restaurant would have offered to take soup off my check--not today.  When my friends ordered a pot of soup to share, I asked our waiter to suggest a salad and he recommended the chopped salad. He kindly told them that one salad would be enough for both of them. I have to give our waiter credit for his wonderful personality. When I ordered the salad for myself, I just didn't realize that I was really ordering a salad for two, also. I could no finish half of it, even without eating much of the cup of soup. Although coined as "chopped," the salad was more shredded--shredded red cabbage, shredded lettuce with a few peanuts and edamame and dried rice noodles! I specifically ordered my salad with dressing "on the side," knowing salad dressings are loaded with oil. The waiter brought my salad with the dressing mixed in, and he tried to convince me that the salad was light and airy and that there wasn't much dressing. I insisted on another one, as I told him that I didn't even usually eat oil. When he returned with another salad he sheepishly told me it was made in the same bowl. But the order was still incorrect. I had to ask for dressing.  Finally when the waiter came with what I thought was a choice of birthday sampler desserts for my friend, we had all kinds of dirty dishes on our table, and I felt like we were being rushed and that no one there cared if my friend was celebrating his very special 83rd birthday. Then the waiter ignored my birthday guest, and told me about the desserts and only showed me the desserts, which was weird. So I requested the waiter to tell the birthday guest what was offered. Why tell me? My Chinese friend did understand, and he said he just wanted ice cream.  I asked his wife if she wanted some to, and she agreed. We waited for a long, long time thinking the waiter would return with two tiny portions of birthday ice cream in those same type of dishes. But when he finally came, he brought two giant bowls (I mean really, really large--like serving bowls) full of ice cream-- each containing 3, maybe 4 huge scoops, enough for a family of eight. I was at a loss for words as I was expecting a little sampler portion for this little 83-year man. They were dumbfounded, too. The waiter asked if they would like to split one, and yes, of course, please! Nonetheless, I had to ask the waiter to bring a separate dish for the gentlemen's wife. He returned with a small bread and butter dish. Well, I'm beginning to understand that if you go to Big Bowl Restaurant, about all you are are big bowls. Anyway, my Chinese friends enjoyed the ice cream, and I asked for the check. The waiter apologized again for the delay, because he said both orders of ice cream were on the bill, and he had to take one off. Silly me, thinking birthday dessert was on the house. Not so! Although, earlier I had alerted the hostess and even another waiter, but nothing else was done to recognize my friend's birthday -- no singing, no pictures, not even wishing him a "happy birthday."
Fantastic food, great service. We had the Shrimp and Scollop with Ginger - out of this world. Also had the Green Curry dish which was awesome. The portions are Huge
Good food:) many dishes are very delicious and healthy. Great service! Awesome managers.

What happened to the FOOD! What happened to the "Niman Ranch Heirloom Pork "? The attached photo shows what the "Slow Roasted Barbecue Pork Fried Rice, with Niman Ranch Heirloom Pork" used to look like.  The "heirloom pork" has been replaced with pork shoulder (or something) plopped on top, and the rice was terribly soggy. Wet soggy (two orders).  You compare. Look at the photos.  Gone was the melt in you mouth pink pork slices, replaced with tough pork cubes. And also missing the sweet dipping sauce.  Compare the rice. Of course photos can miss-represent, but the new version is clearly "moister". OK, if you're going for that, but "moister" should not mean "soggy".   Seems like they replaced the fancy dipping sauce, and instead, spread the sauce "moistened" throughout the whole dish.  In any case, if it was simply replacing food products, no problem. Yes, heirloom pork was better, but things change. However, it was the quality of the preparation (demonstrated in the photos), and in my opinion, the sauces. The dish did not taste "fresh".  Using the Big Bowl, and Wildcard offers, we ordered seven dishes last week, and every single dish was not enjoyable.   Big Bowl is "famous', I might even say it's their "Asia style" to use an abundance of sugar, and salt (if you've eaten there, you know that going in), but this time, the balance was off, way off, and the dish was left uneaten.  We judged the food compared to previous meals, having ordered from Ohio Street since the day they opened.  I remember the often told stories of Rich Melman visiting the Lettuce Entertain You restaurants to check up on the food quality.  I'm sure, 100% sure (guessing but SURE), Big Bowl on Ohio Street has not seen Mr. Melman taste their food in a long, long time.   NOTE:  Many of the "grub hub" type places are still listing the dish including "heirloom pork" , but the Big Bowl Menu has removed the listing.

Service - very friendly and fast on a Saturday night.
